text: Kétvölgy (Slovene: Verica-Ritkarovci; Prekmurje Slovene: Virica-Ritkarofci) is a village in Szentgotthárd District of Vas County. Its population in 2024 was 99. == Location == Kétvölgy is a scattered settlement in the southwestern part of Vas County, in the Vendvidék region along the Rába River, located along the 7458 road. == History == It was formed in 1950 by the merger of two former villages, Vashegyalja (previously called Permise until 1944) and Ritkaháza, initially under the temporary name Ritkaháza. It received its current name in 1951. == Population == In 2022, 86.7% of the population identified as Hungarian, 56.1% as Slovenian, 5.1% as German, 1% as Rusyn, and 3.1% as other non-local nationalities (12.2% did not respond; due to dual identities, the total may exceed 100%). In terms of religion, 63.3% were Roman Catholic, 1% Reformed, 4.1% other Christian, and 5.1% non-religious (26.5% did not respond). == Notes == Category:Villages in Hungary Category:Vas County
title: Kétvölgy
